div.p: This code system http://example.org/fhir/CodeSystem/gridhamd-answer-options-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Occasional
Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Much of the time
Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Almost all the time
Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Occasional
Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Much of the time
Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Almost all the time
Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and Occasional
Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and Much of the time
Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and almost all of the time
Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Occasional
Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Much off the time
Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Almost all of the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Occasional
Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Much of the time
Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Almost all the time
Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Occasional
Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Much of the time
Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Almost all the time
Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and Occasional
Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and Much of the time
Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and almost all of the time
Very Severe (Delusions, hallucinations) and Much off the time
Very Severe (Delusions, hallucinations) and Almost all of the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Occasional
Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Much of the time
Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses nowish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Almost all the time
Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Occasional
Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Much of the time
Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Almost all the time
Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and Occasional
Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and Much of the time
Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and almost all of the time
Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Occasional
Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Much off the time
Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Almost all of the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Occasional
Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Much of the time
Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Almost all the time
Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Occasional
Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Much of the time
Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Almost all the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Much of the time
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Almost all the time
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Occasional
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Much of the time
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Almost all the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Much of the time
Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Almost all the time
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Occasional
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Much of the time
Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Almost all the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and Occasional
Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and Much of the time
Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and almost all of the time
Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function without assistance) and Occasional
Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function withoutassistance) and Much off the time
Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function without assistance) and Almost all of the time
Moderate (Rate of speech clearly reduced with noticeable pauses)
Severe (Interview clearly prolonged due to long breaks; all movements very slowed)
Very Severe (Interview cannot be completed, unresponsive)
Absent (movements within normal range, e.g., occasionally shifts position in seat)
Mild (Doubtful or slight agitation, mild restlessness,e.g., frequently changing position in seat, foottapping, playing with hair, hands, or clothes)
Moderate (Moderate to marked restlessness or agitation, e.g., wringing hands, excessive scratching or picking)
Severe (Cannot sit still or stay seated even for a short period of time; pacing)
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Occasional
Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Much of the time
Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Almost all the time
Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and Occasional
Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and Much of the time
Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and almost all of the time
Very Severe (incapacitating) and Much off the time
Very Severe (incapacitating) and Almost all of the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (some distress) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (some distress) and Much of the time
Mild (some distress) and Almost all the time
Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and almost all of the time
Very Severe (incapacitating) and Much off the time
Very Severe (incapacitating) and Almost all of the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Occasional
Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Much of the time
Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating)and Almost all the time
Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Occasional
Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Much of the time
Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Almost all the time
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Occasional
Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Much of the time
Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Almost all the time
Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Occasional
Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains)and Much of the time
Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Almost all the time
Mild (Some loss of interest or pleasure)
Marked (Marked loss of interest or pleasure)
Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Occasional
Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Much of the time
Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Almost all the time
Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Occasional
Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Much of the time
Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Almost all the time
Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Occasional
Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Much of the time
Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and almost all of the time
Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Occasional
Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Much off the time
Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Almost all of the time
Less than 1 lb. (.5 kg) loss per week since last visit
1-2 lb. (.5 – 1 kg) loss per week since last visit
More than 2-lb (> 1 kg) loss per week since last visit
Any recognition of depressive symptoms, with or without attribution to any cause, e.g., “I’m depressed because my partner always argues with me.
Denies illness but accepts possibility of being ill, e.g., “I don’t think there’s anything wrong, but other people think there is.
Complete denial of having any illness, e.g., “I’m not depressed; I’m fine.
